description.narrative: Expected developmental impacts include: (i) support a key staple food producer in Ecuador, help to secure food supply; (ii) help with the feasibility study and implementation of a program aimed at increasing fortified food supply to poor children & women through the GAIN/IFC AS program; (iii) create new jobs by reviving a bankrupted flour & pasta company which will have a significant impact on the development of a rural area of Ecuador.Expected developmental impacts include: (i) support a key staple food producer in Ecuador, help to secure food supply; (ii) help with the feasibility study and implementation of a program aimed at increasing fortified food supply to poor children & women through the GAIN/IFC AS program; (iii) create new jobs by reviving a bankrupted flour & pasta company which will have a significant impact on the development of a rural area of Ecuador.

Moderna Alimentos S.A. (Moderna, or the Company) leads the wheat flour milling market in Ecuador with 39% market share and sales of $130m in 2009. Leveraging on this strength, Moderna plans to further improve efficiency and expand value-added products (bread, pasta, social programs). Moderna is headquartered in Quito with operations in Quito, Amaguaña, Manta, Riobamba, Guayaquil, and Cayambe.
The Project is for the Company to (i) upgrade wheat/flour storage & logistics; (ii) acquire the assets of Molinos La Union; (iii) start-up Millerecuador S.A. and add a pasta line; and (iv) expand bakery business.
